metadata.title: CVE-2018-11783 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
sslheaders plugin extracts information from the client certificate and sets headers in the request based on the configuration of the plugin. The plugin doesn't strip the headers from the request in some scenarios. This problem was discovered in versions 6.0.0 to 6.0.3, 7.0.0 to 7.1.5, and 8.0.0 to 8.0.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11783` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 8.0.2+ds-1ubuntu1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 8.0.2+ds-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.2+ds-1ubuntu1').
